At fourteen, Simone Fleurier is wrenched from her home on a ProvenÃ§al lavender farm and sent to work in Marseilles. Her life there is hard and impoverished, but Simone discovers the music hall and a dream: to one day be a famous dancer and singer.

But when war threatens, Simone makes a decision that will lead to great danger â€” yet ultimately prove that love, just like wild lavender, can grow in the least likely of places â€¦

Belinda Alexandra has created a tale of passion and courage that moves from the backstreets of Marseilles to the grand music theatres of Paris, from the countryside of Provence to decadent pre-war Berlin and jazz-age New York. 

Wild Lavender is a feast for the senses that will live on in the imagination long after the book is closed. 

About the Author
================

Belinda Alexandra has been published to wide acclaim in Australia, New Zealand, France, Germany, Holland, Poland, Norway and Spain. She is the daughter of a Russian mother and an Australian father and has been an intrepid traveler since her youth.
